channel.title: Homes on Damaris Zurell research
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Damaris Zurell research

item.description: Understanding biodiversity in a changing world I explore how species and communities respond to environmental change across spatial and temporal scales â€” from individual fitness to global distribution patterns. My research integrates principles from theoretical ecology and conservation with advanced statistical and mechanistic modelling to understand why species are where they are, how they got there, and how they will persist in the future. In my group, we develop and test cutting-edge biodiversity models by integrating ecological theory, conservation perspectives, and large-scale data with scenarios of global change.

item.title: People
item.description: For opportunities to join the lab, please have a look here. Group leader: Damaris Zurell (PhD) - Professor of Ecology & Macroecology at University of Potsdam Administrative assistant: Silke Brandt Scientific programmers: Robert Hering (MSc) - ecological data analyst Jette Reeg (PhD) - ecological modeller and scientific programmer Senior & Postdoctoral researchers: Bettina Ohse (PhD) - Individual postdoc project, functional biodiversity, forest disturbances Arman Pili (PhD) - invasion biology, macroecological modelling, functional ecology Juliane Wolter (PhD) - Individual postdoc project, paleoecology, effects of Arctic vegetation changes on carbon dynamics Doctoral researchers:

item.title: Publications
item.description: You can find a full list of my publications here. My ResearcherID is E-2439-2012. You can also find me on ResearchGate and GoogleScholar.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Teaching materials for practicals: Block course R introductory/preparatory course, Master programme “Ecology, Evolution and Conservation” Practicals for MSc module Quantitative conservation biogeography, Master programme “Ecology, Evolution and Conservation”: applied population modelling wit RangeShiftR Practicals for MSc module Macroecology and global change, Master programme “Ecology, Evolution and Conservation”: macroecological analyses, species distribution modelling Practicals for MSc module Ecosystem dynamics and biodiversity, Master programme “Climate, Earth, Water, Sustainability”: species distribution modelling, spatially-explicit population modelling, general ecosystem modelling Short (half-day) course Introduction to species distribution modelling in R - last updated November 2020 Current teaching:

item.title: Downloads
item.description: You can download some of my codes from my github site. Latest software developments in my team include: an R package for the RangeShifter platform. More info under https://rangeshifter.github.io a Shiny web app introducing and facilitating the usage of the ODMAP protocol for reporting SDM. Check out here: odmap.wsl.ch
